intro: Lophiaris quichensis, commonly known as the Quiché spurge, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Central America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features striking yellow flowers surrounded by prominent red bracts, making it visually distinctive. It typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
